Class Rational

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Number
      • Rational
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Rational
extends java.lang.Number
    This class represents a fraction. It has two ints. A numerator and a denominator. It also provides many helpful methods for creating new fractions such as basic arthmetic operations and simplification. It can also find the greatest common factor of a fraction and convert them to a string.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jacob Binder
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rational

        public Rational​(int numerator,
                int denominator)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constuct a new fraction with two int arguements. Denominator cannot be 0. If the denominator is negative, it turns it positive and the numerator negative. If the numerator and the denominator are negative, it turns them both positive.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • Rational

        public Rational​(double value)
        Constuct a new fraction with a double. Puts the double over 100 and multiplies by 100. Rational is unsimplified.

    • Method Detail

      • getNumerator

        public int getNumerator()
        Gets the numerator.

      • getDenominator

        public int getDenominator()
        Gets the denominator.

      • addRational

        public Rational addRational​(Rational r2)
        Acts on one Rational and takes another as a argument. Returns a new Rational upon completion. If the denominators are different, it multiplies the denominators to find a common factor. If the denominators are different, it finds the new numerator by multiplying the numerator of the first Rational by the denominator of the second and vice versa. Then it just adds the numerators.

      • subtractRational

        public Rational subtractRational​(Rational r2)
        Acts on one Rational and takes another as a argument. Returns a new Rational upon completion. If the denominators are different, it multiplies the denominators to find a common factor. If the denominators are different, it finds the new numerator by multiplying the numerator of the first Rational by the denominator of the second and vice versa. Then it just subtracts the numerators.

      • multiplyRational

        public Rational multiplyRational​(Rational r2)
        Returns a new fraction. Multiplies two fractions straight across.

      • divideRational

        public Rational divideRational​(Rational r2)
        Returns a new fraction. Multiplies by the reciporcal.

      • simplifyRational

        public Rational simplifyRational()
        Simplifies the fraction using the greatest common factor. Creates new rational.

      • greatestCommonFactor

        public int greatestCommonFactor()
        Takes a rational and finds the GCF. Sets the smaller number(from numerator and denominator) equal to x and the larger equal to y. Z is then set to x for use in the loop. It then looks to see if the x will go into y without a remainder. If it does than it is the GCF. If not then it will divide x in half since it cannot be any number over half. It then counts down until it finds a number that will divide into both x and y without a remainder. If it doesn't find one, the GCF will be 1.

      • createReciporcal

        public Rational createReciporcal()
        Flips the value of the numerator and denominator and returns the Rational.
